headline: Basic Mashed Potatoes
description: Homemade mashed potatoes are easy to make with this classic 5-ingredient recipe. Guaranteed smooth, creamy, and delicious and perfect for the holidays!

video.description: See how to make good old-fashioned mashed potatoes.
video.name: Basic Mashed Potatoes

name: Basic Mashed Potatoes
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds baking potatoes, peeled and quartered
3 cloves garlic, peeled, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and garlic, lower heat to medium, and simmer until potatoes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
When the potatoes are almost finished, heat milk and butter in a small saucepan over low heat until butter is melted.
Drain potatoes and return to the pot. Slowly add warm milk mixture, blending it in with a potato masher or electric mixer until potatoes are smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: It is good. But it needs more butter.

I have been making mashed potatoes for over 50 years - following my mom’s teaching me the basics. My sister-in-law brought the use a whole stick of butter when cooking for 8 servings. We have used the hand masher in the 1960s but once mom bought an electric beater that has always been how we mashed the cooked/boiled potatoes. I slice the butter and place them around the bowl in an inverted pyramid style. So once my butter has softened a tad then adding in the hot drained potatoes the butter melts into the whipped potatoes. I only use 2tablespoons of milk or sour cream. Some family members don’t like garlic so I may not use any. BUTTER is the key flavoring.
The best I've ever made. I did the recipe as-is, but mixed them and the melted milk/butter in a stand mixer, and the consistency is perfect - light and fluffy. NOT watery, and just enough butter.
Need more butter
So easy and definitely keeping for the future!

Decent primer for those of us that haven't made mashed potatoes before. I added the liquid too quickly and ended up with slightly soupy potatoes which I ended up baking for a bit in the oven to lose some of the moisture. Overall, the flavor was there.

Too much milk! The taste is great. Enough butter. However, too runny for my taste. That makes it a three. When you follow a recipe and add too much of something, can't easily fix it. I would start with 2/3 cup milk and then add more as needed.
The best mashed potatoes I've ever made. Everyone loved them.
Love it super easy and straight forward!!
it is soupy but it comes out delicious i don’t exactly know how much is two pounds because i use grams

Decent enough recipe, but… First, not enough butter. Use at least half a cup. Second, if you want fluffy MP, after draining the salted water, put the potatoes back on the burner on low heat for a couple of minutes stirring with a wooden spoon. This dries the potatoes. Then, put them through a ricer and add hot milk and butter slowly to the consistency you like. If you use a ricer, a masher is not necessary, just a wooden spoon. The use of a ricer and drying the potatoes are the secrets to great MP whether one uses milk, half & half, cream, sour cream or cream cheese with the butter. Salt the water and let others add extra salt if desired.
i like it this way but a lot of times, I like to make it with cream instead of milk. Either way it is good.

Such a simple recipe. I am a good cook, but I can't make mashed potatoes. I used this recipe, watched the video and they were great! A little lumpier than I preferred but that's user error for not cooking them long enough. (Too afraid of overcooking them!) I ran out of pots so I microwaved the milk and butter and it turned out fine. Yey! I finally made good mashed potatoes with this recipe! Thank you!!!

I did this and it’s good, I used whole milk and added more butter because I like my mashed potato buttery taste. It’s also my first time making mashed potato and I’m so happy it turned out really good. Thank you for sharing your recipe. It’s a big help for first timers.

Love this simple recipe. I did reserve about a quarter of a cup of potato water. I also did melt the butter with the milk. I like skins on my potatoes, so skins on it is. I prefer chunkier potatoes then smooth.
I made it to go with Ikea meatballs. Followed the recipe exactly. Super simple, easy, and great! Will definitely make them again!
Very easy to make. I added a couple extra tablespoons of butter.
This was a great, simple recipe! I used a bag old potatoes that were wrinkly, but it didn't effect the recipe. I also used powdered milk instead of liquid milk, but it still works!
It was good
Exactly as advertised. Delicious. Thank you

Can't miss with mashed taters. I like mine just a _little_ bit more luxurious, so I'll use cream and a bit more butter than this, plus add chopped, roasted garlic. Make a lot! Mashies reheat easily and well.
amazing
In step 2 I added minced garlic, parsley, and sour cream. Got too much liquid in it (my bad) so baked it off in the oven. Good side for meatloaf. Cut potatoes smaller for faster cooking.

This is an okay recipe and I liked that they tried to keep it simple. But even then they made it more complicated than necessary. I've been making mashed potatoes for 50 years and everyone loves them. It's about this easy. Go ahead and use the cheaper russet potatoes, even the kind you get in a dirt cheap five pound bag, they work fine. Peel and cut them up in similar sized pieces. Boil until they are falling apart tender, not "firm". Beat them with an electric mixer, it works far better than a potato masher. The real key is to beat them while still hot, just after draining the water, and beat them until smooth without ANY of the other ingredients. Beat them a lot. Then just add a fair amount of butter, and start adding some milk, you don't have to heat the butter or milk first, that makes no difference. Also salt and pepper to taste. Add more milk as necessary (half and half is even better) until you get a creamy consistency, not too stiff, not too runny. If you want to get fancy and like it, add a few cloves of crushed garlic. That's it.
They looked awesome. I added fresh garlic. It was still missing a lot of flavor. Maybe sour cream or heavy cream is needed?
So so good, I thought they looked a little mushy but they were amazing!

That’s exactly what it says it is, basic mashed potatoes. It’s also a perfect starting point to make mashed potatoes with all kinds of goodies. I omitted most of the milk and I substituted with sour cream. I added garlic, shredded Parmesan, fresh parsley and chive.
I usually boil the potatoes for longer than the recipe calls for, but that's the only adjustment I need.
This is the basic recipe of course season to your liking
absolutely amazing
It was very easy to do thank you
It was really easy to make. I substitued instant potatoes for the ones in the bag. I also added all half and half while I boiled it. I added just a little salt to taste. They were fantastic!
Unless you plan on mashing for an hour, plan to boil 25-30 minutes and mash the potatoes before adding the milk instead of at the same time.

I was making another dish that called for a layer of mashed potatoes on top. The potatoes in that dish didn't have any milk in them and I had never made mashed potatoes from scratch before (I always used instant). I decided to look for another recipe that used milk and this one gave me a much better idea of what to do. I can't say I followed the measurements exactly. I really just added milk and butter until they looked the consistency I wanted, but they turned out fantastic :)

Thanks for helping out a newbie in cooking from scratch!
I did not have any sour cream or creamer so I tried this 4- ingredients mashed potatoes and it was very good, thank you :). I will probably cook mashed potatoes this way for your everyday dinner.
I also slice half an onion very thin and add that to the mix for extra flavour
Loved it. Didn’t need to do the second step
This will be the second time I made these, once with Red potatoes and another time with Purple potatoes both came out Wonderful!!
an excellent recipe my mashed potatoes came out fluffy
Delicious! I loved these potatoes! I recommend only putting one or two TEAspoons of salt. I put one table spoon and it was very salty.
Easy to understand for an inexperienced cook. Recommend beating in a deep bowl rather than shallow. LOL

Perfectly simple and simply perfect. I added half a stick of butter instead of a quarter stick (2 tablespoons) and they turned out just right for me. Also, I leave the skins on cause I'm a bit lazy, it's supposed to be better for you, and I kinda like the red flecks of potato skin in the finished dish.
Classic basic mashed potatoes!

I used this recipe...wish I would have read some of the comments before hand. I was making potatoes for 10 so when ingredients were adjusted it called for 2-1/2 C. of milk! It actually was fine with 1/2 C. milk. Bummer to waste two cups of milk. Otherwise, this is a very good recipe.

This is my first time making mashed potatoes on my own and I liked this recipe. They weren't special mashed potatoes but it was a good recipe and I think if you're starting out, like me, this a great recipe.
It was super simple and delicious! Thank you!!!
Turned out perfectly. The recipe is just perfect
Very easy to make. Added Chives

I made this and am very disappointed. I put all the butter and milk in at the same time and it was sloppy, like soup. I am baking potatoes right now to try to fix the mix. Not happy - I have a sirloin tip roast waiting for veg.!!
it was not good at All my potatoes were nothing like mashed potatoes are there is to much milk in the recipe and not anode butter I do not recommend this recipe for any on.
These potatoes turned out very good. They were the perfect side dish for a turkey dinner.
easy and popular
It tast great and easy
More butter and less milk.
Loved. Easy! Will make again!!!
It was delicious it was my first time making homemade mashed potatoes Thank you
I cooked it until firm like the recipe said. It ended up chunky and soupy. I couldn't get myself to eat it because it kept getting worse. TOO MUCH MILK NOT ENOUGH BUTTER!! DON'T MAKE THIS!!!

Thanks Esmee Williams and each of you that commented,
Last week I made these and added too much milk. Ugh. Cream of Wheat. Yesterday, June 16, 2020, cut back the ingredients for only my wife and me. I steamed seven small Golden potatoes. Heated and added half a stick of butter, half cup whipping cream, four dabs cream cheese. Success. Served with Cajun pork loan, and corn on the cob (microwaved wrapped in plastic smothered in mayo). Delicious. Thanks again. Blessings, Jack
One of the few times where the food actually turns out perfect. And I suck at cooking lol, so the fact that these were on point really surprised me. 5 stars

They were not very lumpy so they had a pretty smooth consistency, Maybe I'll use a tad more butter and milk next time just to get a little creamier. 
 Overall The best homemade taters I have made! :)
Great mashed potatoes easy, fast, and tasted great. My family of 4 loved it.
Very fluffy and tasty. Never had thought of hearing the milk and butter first. A must try recipe! And simple too!
It’s very easy and tasty

This was so easy to make especially when it is pressure cooked than boiled. After the time it gets the pot up to pressure, it took 10 minutes to soften the potatoes. Creamy, smooth mashed potatoes indeed! We are a family of 4, we had no leftovers. The kids wanted more. My kids (12 & 10) made this recipe themselves.
I would say it turned out a little runnier than I hoped.
Super easy and relatively quick to make!
I sure hope I can make it again

Welp..... I followed the recipe using gold potatoes and my taters were gummy, thick and sticky. Probably all my fault, though. I used 1 stick of butter and 1 cup of cream to make them extra rich (forget counting calories on this one.) I'm thinking I over mashed them. BUT the upside is the family loved them and went back for seconds. Even the kiddo who usually doesn't like mashed potatoes (who doesn't like mashed potatoes?!) ate them right up.
Love this simple and easy recipe. Never fails me. Always comes out perfect. i did use garlic salt instead of regular salt, but other than that, I followed the recipe as described.
Simple and delicious!
Changed my mind on what to cook for dinner & decided to have mashed potatoes. Thanks for this easy recipe
I added quite a bit more butter for a creamier consistency. Would make again!

Cooked the potatoes a lil longer. Bout 23 minutes. Potatoes began to break on their own. 

A signal they were done. 

Customized recipe by adding 1 whole stick of butter.
Steam of potatoes will melt the butter while mashing.

Seasoned with Garlic Herb Spice.

Poured in 1 cup of whole milk. Mashed and mixed.

Texture came out lovely.
Too many milk
Easy, quick recipe and delicious

This is a great mashed potato recipe the only problem with it is the potatoes should be put in cold water. You don't boil the water and then add the potatoes I learned this from a professional chef. Starting them in cold water ensures they cook evenly and they don't get gummy. Happy cooking
was delicious

These are SO delicious! Sometimes simple is the best! I used Yukon Gold potatoes and also light cream. I've learned that after draining the potatoes, return them to the pan and steam for a few min to dry them out a bit. So rich and creamy, I could eat a bowl of this! Thanks for this easy guide!
The potatoes will still be VERY hard and too firm to mash if following this recipe. I recommend cutting the potatoes into small pieces to boil or boiling for an extra 10-15 minutes
the BEST mashed potatoes (the only recipe I've tried) but STILL!!
I didn’t change a thing. They were just perfect . Very easy to make.
So good!

The recipe turned out great. They were real easy to prepare and cook. The whole recipe from start to finish only took me a half an hour. It was well worth it. The potatoes turned out creamy and smooth, and I had plenty of leftover. They were the envy of my office lunchroom. My wife loved them as well. She told me she is now spoiled. I will never go back to the boxed potato flakes again. They are well worth the slightly extra time. Excellent.
First time making mashed potatoes and worked perfectly. I *mostly* pealed the potatoes but left some skin on them. I added garlic salt and cayenne pepper based on other comments.
I agree about needing more Butter - I used a whole stick and they turned out great!
I didn’t make any changes other than adding a tiny bit more milk as it was a little dry. Over all fantastic though.

Good old fashioned mashed potatoes. Better than my mother's (sorry, mom). I needed help with proportions of potatoes, milk and butter . . . and heating the milk and butter before adding really made a difference in keeping them hot (Duh!). But I had never thought of that before.
I followed recipe to a T but multiplied all quantities by 5 since making 10 lbs potatoes for thanksgiving. Perfect!!! Rave reviews from my guests!
Made it as recommended with a little more butter. It was prefect!
My family loved how creamy and buttery these potatoes tasted! I used half and half instead of milk but love the idea of warming it with the butter first. Perfecto!
just like momma used to make! mwa!
Great easy recipe for mash potatoes-family loved them.
Easy enough to follow and it turned out great! I didn't quite get the ratio right but that mistake was on me.

This is how I always make our mash potatoes. But I never measure milk or butter -- eye ball and taste as I go. This is a great benchmark to start with. Of course I don't know how much my potatoes weigh either so it's a little guessing game.
I used salted butter once since I ran out of unsalted. Surprisingly, I got a compliment that it was soooo good. So I been using salted butter ever since. Salt in water as well. Today i used 75% whole milk and 25% cream. Yum!
I'm pressed for time and need to make these fast. This mash potatoes recipe is so yumny and so easy to make.
so easy, yummy i loved it!
I suggest if you are lactose intolerant try using chicken broth instead of milk. Yummy!
Something so simple made great, it definitely put my cooking at a higher level.
I went by the recipe and they came out amazing. I'm amazed that the first time making mashed potatoes that they came out awesome.
